Uses of Package
org.jpac

  • Packages that use org.jpac 
    Package Description
    jpac.test.fg  
    org.jpac  
    org.jpac.alarm  
    org.jpac.console  
    org.jpac.opc  
    org.jpac.plc  
    org.jpac.snapshot  
  • Classes in org.jpac used by jpac.test.fg 
    Class and Description
    AbstractModule
    base class of elbfisch modules
    Decimal
    represents a decimal signal
    InputInterlockException
    thrown at a module (inside work()), if the application code implemented inside AbstractModule.preCheckInterlocks() encounters an error condition
    Logical
    represents a boolean signal
    Module
    an elbfisch module
    OutputInterlockException
    thrown at a module (inside work()), if the application code implemented inside AbstractModule.postCheckInterlocks() encounters an error condition
    ProcessException
    base class of all jPac related exceptions
  • Classes in org.jpac used by org.jpac 
    Class and Description
    AbstractModule
    base class of elbfisch modules
    AbstractModule.Status 
    AbstractModule.StatusStack 
    CharString
    represents a char string signal
    CharStringChanges
    process event indicating, that the value of a char string signal has changed
    ConjunctiveEvent
    used to combine a number events in a conjunctive way.
    CyclicBuffer
    used to synchronize two threads having a producer - consumer relation the data objects stored inside the buffer are recycled as far as possible
    CyclicTask
    used to implement cyclic tasks.
    Decimal
    represents a decimal signal
    DecimalChanges
    process event indicating, that the value of a decimal signal has changed
    DecimalExceeds
    process event indicating, that the value of a decimal signal exceeds a given value
    DecimalFallsBelow
    process event indicating, that the value of a decimal signal has fallen below a given value
    DecimalMapper
    used to map a decimal signal to another decimal signal.
    DisjunctiveEvent
    used to combine a number events in a disjunctive way.
    EmergencyStopException
    thrown, if an emergency stop condition arises.
    EventTimedoutException
    thrown, if an awaited event, did not occur in time
    ExclusiveDisjunctiveEvent
    used to combine a number events in a exclusive disjunctive way.
    Fireable
    base class of all event, which might occur during the life time of an elbfisch application
    InconsistencyException
    thrown, if an internal error has been encountered by the runtime environment of jPac
    InputInterlockException
    thrown at a module (inside work()), if the application code implemented inside AbstractModule.preCheckInterlocks() encounters an error condition
    InterlockException
    base class for interlock exceptions
    InvalidPropertyException
    thrown, if an error occurs, while accessing a property
    JPac
    central runtime engine of JPac
    JPac.CycleMode 
    JPac.Status 
    JPac.TraceQueue
    used to hold the latest tracing information for a given number of execution cycles.
    Logical
    represents a boolean signal
    MonitorException
    thrown at a module (inside work()), if an event (Fireable) has been fired, which is monitored by it
    NumberOutOfRangeException
    thrown, if a value to be assigned to decimal or signed integer exceeds the signals range of values
    OutputInterlockException
    thrown at a module (inside work()), if the application code implemented inside AbstractModule.postCheckInterlocks() encounters an error condition
    ProcessEvent
    base class for all process events which can be await()ed by modules
    ProcessException
    base class of all jPac related exceptions
    RemoteSignalConnection
    represents a connection to a remote Jpac instance.
    RemoteSignalException
    thrown, if a problem with a remote signal arises
    RemoteSignalFrame
    represents a collection of signals, which are connected to remote signals and changed during the same cycle.
    RemoteSignalHandler
    rmi skeleton of the RemoteSignalHandler
    RemoteSignalOutput
    represents a remote output signal
    RemoteSignalOutputDaemon
    handles the communication with a remote jPac instance.
    RemoteSignalRegistry
    central registry for all signals instantiated inside an application implemented as singleton
    ShutdownRequestException
    is thrown at every module (inside work()), if some instance (another module calling shutdown() or the OS) requests a shutdown of the elbfisch application.
    Signal
    implements the base features of a signal
    SignalAccessException
    thrown, if a module tries to set() a signal, which does not belong to it (the module is not the containing module of the signal), or the signal is connected by another signal as a target signal.
    SignalAlreadyConnectedException
    thrown, if a attempt is made to connect a signal as a target more than once
    SignalAlreadyExistsException
    thrown, if a signal with the same name already exists
    SignalInvalidException
    thrown, if an attempt is made to read a signal which is invalid
    SignalNotRegisteredException
    thrown, if an attempt is made to fetch a signal, which is not present (registered) yet
    SignalObserver 
    SignalRegistry
    central registry for all signals instantiated inside an application implemented as singleton
    SignedInteger
    represents a signed integer signal
    SignedIntegerChanges
    process event indicating, that the value of a signed integer signal has changed
    SignedIntegerExceeds
    process event indicating, that the value of a signed integer signal exceeds a given threshold
    SignedIntegerFallsBelow
    process event indicating, that the value of a signed integer signal falls below a given threshold
    SignedIntegerMapper
    used to map a signed integer signal to another signed integer signal.
    Timer
    a timer
    TimerExpires
    process event indicating, that a timer expired
    Value
    represents a value of a signal
    WrongUseException
